intro: Alyxia composita, commonly known as the Florida mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Alyxia composita is adapted to wetland and swampy habitats, making it an important component of the wetland flora in its native range.
